meanings.definition: To march back along the same route.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers countermarched to return to their base.
meanings.sent2: After reaching the dead-end, they countermarched to the starting point.
meanings.sent3: The confused troops countermarched, ending up where they began.
meanings.sent4: The dancers countermarched gracefully, mirroring each other's steps.
meanings.sent5: The ants countermarched in perfect unison, creating intricate patterns on the ground.

meanings.definition: To reverse the direction of a march.
meanings.sent1: The general ordered the troops to countermarch and head back.
meanings.sent2: Realizing the mistake, the platoon countermarched swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The parade countermarched comically, causing laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The river countermarched around the bend, surprising the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The clouds countermarched in the sky, changing their course suddenly.

meanings.definition: To move in a military formation in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent1: The army countermarched to confuse the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers countermarched skillfully during the training exercise.
meanings.sent3: The penguins countermarched playfully, amusing the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The school of fish countermarched swiftly, avoiding the predator.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers countermarched flawlessly, impressing the judges.
